definition: name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people

sentences.english: Normally, specialty goods have a brand name or other distinguishing characteristics.
sentences.chinese: 名產通常是名牌，或具有其它產品沒有的特點。

sentences.english: No dates are ribose Ruicheng County famous West Village street.
sentences.chinese: 無核糖棗是芮城縣西陌鄉的名產。

sentences.english: She brought us to the tour place to have their traditional food.
sentences.chinese: 她帶我們去觀光勝地喫名產。

sentences.english: Changshan has rich resources and abundant special local products.
sentences.chinese: 常山資源豐富，名產衆多。

sentences.english: Look at the map and name a souvenir from each place.
sentences.chinese: 看地圖並將各地的名產填入空格。

sentences.english: Ruicheng County famous West Village street.
sentences.chinese: 無核糖棗是芮城縣西陌鄉的名產。

definition: oden, Japanese dish made with boiled eggs, processed fish cakes, daikon radish, tofu etc in a kelp-based broth
suncake (small round cake made with flaky pastry and a maltose filling, originally from Taichung, Taiwan)
Wufeng township in Taichung county 臺中縣|台中县[Tai2 zhong1 xian4], Taiwan
gift given when visiting sb (esp. a local specialty brought back from one's travels, or a special product of one's own country taken overseas) (Tw)
Hyōgo prefecture in the midwest of Japan's main island Honshū 本州[Ben3 zhou1]
variant of 熱乎乎|热乎乎[re4 hu1 hu1]
tempura/deep-fried cooking/also called 甜不辣[tian2 bu4 la4]
Wulai township in New Taipei City 新北市[Xin1 bei3 shi4], Taiwan
